page.title: 06BREWERIES OF OAKHILL
page.content: The long established industry of Oakhill is brewing, which was begun in the 1790's. In recent years after a serious fire, in 1925, the original Oakhill Brewery was reorganised and Courage sited a Maltings in the village. The building is now used for drying and soaking the malt. In 1986 there is hoped to be an expansion of 10 more silos to hold grain, but there is a lot of controversy about it in the village. It employs 17 people. One of the buildings of the old brewery is now used as an independent brewery. During recent years 3 men have produced between 20 and 50 barrels of beer a week. One man does the deliveries and the other two make the beer. They call themselves the Oakhill Brewery and sell the beer in the surrounding area.
